turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Medworxx.
turn.1: What are Medworxx's Patient Flow systems?
turn.2: The company's patient flow solution Clinical Criteria is to be used in the Crouse Hospital, Syracruse, New York. Medworxx Patient Flow systems were used by South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust in a Bed Utilisation Review Project in 2011 across the trust's multiple sites conducted by Model Advice DC Consulting Ltd.
turn.3: What is the South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust?
turn.4: The trust subsequently adopted the company's web-based integrated patient flow solution.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Royal Liverpool and Broadgreen University Hospitals NHS Trust was the first UK organisation to adopt the Medworxx clinical utilisation management system in November 2011.
turn.8: By January 2012 the proportion of elective patients ready to leave the hospital had reduced from 5.4% to 4.6%, while non-electives had reduced from more than 7% to 5.8%.
turn.10: The trust won the National EHealth Insider Award in the category of "Outstanding work in IT-enabled change in healthcare" for their project titled "First UK IT Enabled Hospital Case Management System" in October 2012.
turn.11: What is the most important aspect of Medworxx?
turn.12: The trust chose the Medworxx clinical utilisation management system as the most suitable for use in conjunction with a case management approach to patient flow.
